B2 the period of time during which someone lives or something exists: We'll see a tremendous lot of technological changes during/in our lifetime. Winners of the competition will receive the holiday of a lifetime (= the best holiday they will ever have). I've only been working here two days, but it seems like a lifetime. A watch of this quality should last a lifetime. Enter our competition and this once-in-a-lifetime experience could be yours! Marriage is no longer always seen as a lifetime commitment. You could win a lifetime's supply of toothpaste. Synonyms
life (TIME ALIVE)
lifespan
More examplesFewer examplesShe was given the award for a lifetime of public service.In the past, the majority of women were consigned to a lifetime of servitude and poverty.It's very difficult to shake the habit of a lifetime.We will not see a cure for cancer in my lifetime.He was worn out by a lifetime of hard work.
